subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} [[File:Beer_and_edamame_(boild_green_soybeans).jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|肴}}, {{l|ja|魚}} (''sakana''): a [[side dish]] served with [[alcoholic]] [[beverage]]s.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|さかな|yomi=k}} Compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=さかな}} elements {{compound|ja|sort=さかな|酒|tr1=saka|t1=sake, rice wine|pos1=old combining form of modern ''sake'' reading|菜|tr2=na|t2=side dish}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}{{R:Daijirin}}{{R:Daijisen}} Likely source of {{cog|ryu|さかな|tr=sakana}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|さかな}}

# [[fish]]
# a [[side dish]] served with [[alcoholic]] [[beverage]]s: not necessarily [[fish]], may be a [[vegetable]] or other [[meat]]
# [[entertainment]] at a [[drinking]] [[party]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The {{m|en|fish}} sense is more commonly spelled {{ja-l|魚}}.

subSections.title: Idioms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
[[File:GrilledCongridae.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|肴}} (''na''): fish as a [[side dish]].]]
{{ja-kanjitab|な|yomi=kun}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=な}}. Also spelled variously in kanji in modern Japanese as {{m|ja|肴|pos=for meat or fish}}, {{m|ja|菜|pos=for vegetables}}, {{m|ja|魚|pos=for fish}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} This reading appears to be obsolete in modern Japanese.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|な}}

# a [[side dish]], be it [[meat]] or [[fish]] or [[greens]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
